abstracts.cdata!:
The Park Rehabilitation and Conservation
            Project objective was to enhance the Government's
            ability to protect wildlife Populations, and their habitats,
            and to rehabilitate essential elements of infrastructure,
            strengthening the institutionalcapacity of agencies
            responsible for the sustainability of investments, and for
            the formulation of policy and implementation of wildlife
            programs. This Project Completion Note specifies the reasons
            for project cancellation as follows. The difficult economic
            and political crisis in Zimbabwe accelerated, with problems
            servicing  external debts, and by March 2000, the government
            defaulted on its loans to the Bank, and other international
            financial institutions. As a result, the Bank suspended
            disbursements on all projects in Zimbabwe on May 16,200O.
            The economic crisis worsened during the past four years, and
            the country's arrears continue to rise. Zimbabwe has
            not made any effort to clear its arrears to the Bank. The
            project was closed, and the undisbursed funds from both the
            Credit and Grant were cancelled on June 25, 2002 some 25
            months after the Bank suspended disbursements to Zimbabwe,
            as a result of the government's inability to service
            its loans to the Bank. The original closing date was 30
            September 2005.
